thread.title: Seats on London Underground train lines aren't shampooed
thread.title_full: Seats on London Underground train lines aren't shampooed

title: Seats on London Underground train lines aren't shampooed
text: Share 15 shares While they reportedly aren't washed, seats on the Bakerloo, Central, Victoria, Metropolitan, Circle, District and Hammersmith & City are brushed each night. They are then hoovered every 21 days during a more intensive clean of all surfaces including floors and poles. Passengers shouldn't be able to complain too much about dust on the Jubilee, Northern and Piccadilly lines though, as seats are vacuumed every night and floors are mopped. The carriages also undergo a deeper clean every 17 to 23 days. For the lines where seats are shampooed, the Victoria Line is given the most attention. Furnishings are washed every 24 weeks whereas the Bakerloo Line's seats see water every 36 weeks and the Central Line is shampooed just once a year. Annually 1.3billion passengers travel on London's Underground network (file image) HOW OFTEN SEATS ARE WASHED Victoria Line - every 24 weeks Bakerloo Line - every 36 weeks Central Line - every 52 weeks District - never
